titlestmt.author: Julia Taylor, Emily Brooks

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Voices Breaking Boundaries Records 1999/2016

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: This collection contains materials from Voices Breaking Boundaries’ (VBB) history and administration, planning documents, event materials, press clippings and audio-visual materials.

bioghist.head: Historical Note:
bioghist.p: Voices Breaking Boundaries is a grassroots non-profit arts organization founded in 2000 by writer and artist Sehba Sarwar along with four other women – Marcela Descalzi, Jacsun Shah, Donna Perkins and Christine Choi. Initially the collective hosted readings at a Houston bookstore, but evolved into a dynamic, multi-disciplinary organization. Voices Breaking Boundaries art productions aim to examine issues connected to education, race, women’s right, demography and more from a global perspective.

Major productions include; La Voz Feminina, held each International Women’s Day, the Living Room art series, Words for Peace, East End Live Art and more. Voices Breaking Boundaries participated in the Houston Art Car Parade in 2010, and since 2013 have been producing publications of VBB artists and writers work.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accruals.head: Accruals:
accruals.p: Additional materials acquired on September 24, 2015. Digital files were transffered on multiple occassions 2014-2016.

processinfo.head: Processing Information:
processinfo.p: Original collection (7 linear feet) was processed by Julia Taylor in 2015-2016. Additions were processed and a final finding aid was produced by Emily Brooks later in 2016.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Photocopy decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Voices Breaking Boundaries Records. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials from Voices Breaking Boundaries’ (VBB) history and administration, planning documents, event materials, press clippings and audio-visual materials.

In addition to paper records, this collection also contains digital archival material. Digital archival materials can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. Because not all of these materials are processed, these materials may require up to two weeks to access. Some files may be restricted and not available for access at all. Contact the curator for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains writing samples, paperwork, and lesson plans from camps and workshops provided to teenagers by Voices Breaking Boundaries.

scopecontent.p: This series contains documents related to human resources and employment such as employee manuals, job descriptions, hiring processes and correspondence, and staff and artist employment and payment records.

scopecontent.p: Folder names reflect original organization and naming. Materials include primarily digital photographs, fliers, and production files. Some fliers that were eventually produced may be duplicated in the print collection. Files were transffered from both Sehba Sarwar's laptop and an external hard drive on September 24, 2015. Files saved at 2014-015_002_vbb. 16.6GB (approximately 18,273 files).

did.unittitle: Second hard drive transfer from Sehba's computer

scopecontent.p: Folder names reflect original organization and naming. Files transffered on October 14, 2016. Files saved at 2014-015_005_vbb. 26.1GB (approximately 6,568 files).

did.unittitle: Third hard drive transfer from Sehba's Mac hard drive

scopecontent.p: This digital accession is not yet processed and may not be available for research.

scopecontent.p: Interviews produced as a part of the University of Houston course History 6383 in fall 2014 taught by Professor Kairn Klieman. Most interviews consist of .mp3 audio files as well as .docx transcripts. Some also include video. Interviews missing release forms are marked [closed]. Files saved at 2014-015_001_vbb.
